Uses of Class
java.nio.Buffer

Packages that use Buffer
android.graphics Provides low level graphics tools such as canvases, color filters, points, and rectangles that let you handle drawing to the screen directly. 
android.opengl Provides OpenGL utilities. 
java.nio Provides buffers that help handling data. 
javax.microedition.khronos.opengles   
 

Uses of Buffer in android.graphics
 

Methods in android.graphics with parameters of type Buffer
 void Bitmap.copyPixelsFromBuffer(Buffer src)
          Copy the pixels from the buffer, beginning at the current position, overwriting the bitmap's pixels.
 void Bitmap.copyPixelsToBuffer(Buffer dst)
          Copy the bitmap's pixels into the specified buffer (allocated by the caller).

Uses of Buffer in java.nio
 

Subclasses of Buffer in java.nio
(package private)  class BaseByteBuffer
          Serves as the root of other byte buffer impl classes, implements common methods that can be shared by child classes.
 class ByteBuffer
          A buffer for bytes.
(package private)  class CharArrayBuffer
          CharArrayBuffer, ReadWriteCharArrayBuffer and ReadOnlyCharArrayBuffer compose the implementation of array based char buffers.
 class CharBuffer
          A buffer of chars.
(package private)  class CharSequenceAdapter
          This class wraps a char sequence to be a char buffer.
(package private)  class CharToByteBufferAdapter
          This class wraps a byte buffer to be a char buffer.
(package private)  class DirectByteBuffer
          DirectByteBuffer, ReadWriteDirectByteBuffer and ReadOnlyDirectByteBuffer compose the implementation of platform memory based byte buffers.
(package private)  class DoubleArrayBuffer
          DoubleArrayBuffer, ReadWriteDoubleArrayBuffer and ReadOnlyDoubleArrayBuffer compose the implementation of array based double buffers.

          A buffer of doubles.

Methods in java.nio that return Buffer
 Buffer Buffer.clear()
          Clears this buffer.
 Buffer Buffer.flip()
          Flips this buffer.
 Buffer Buffer.limit(int newLimit)
          Sets the limit of this buffer.
 Buffer Buffer.mark()
          Marks the current position, so that the position may return to this point later by calling reset().
 Buffer Buffer.position(int newPosition)
          Sets the position of this buffer.
 Buffer Buffer.reset()
          Resets the position of this buffer to the mark.
 Buffer Buffer.rewind()
          Rewinds this buffer.
 

Methods in java.nio with parameters of type Buffer
(package private) static Object NIOAccess.getBaseArray(Buffer b)
          Returns the underlying Java array containing the data of the given Buffer, or null if the Buffer is not backed by a Java array.
(package private) static int NIOAccess.getBaseArrayOffset(Buffer b)
          Returns the offset in bytes from the start of the underlying Java array object containing the data of the given Buffer to the actual start of the data.
(package private) static long NIOAccess.getBasePointer(Buffer b)
          Returns the underlying native pointer to the data of the given Buffer starting at the Buffer's current position, or 0 if the Buffer is not backed by native heap storage.
(package private) static int NIOAccess.getRemainingBytes(Buffer b)
          Returns the number of bytes remaining in the given Buffer.
